head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 4 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: The Gospel of S. Matthew, ch. i. 1 —vi. 20, according to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The Gospel of S. Matthew, ch. i. 1 —vi. 20, according to the Peshitta version.
msItem.note: The lessons are rubricated in the text.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 7 1/8 in. by 4 1/2, consisting of ten leaves. The number of lines in each page varies from 19 to 21. The writing is good and regular, of the xiith cent., with a very few Greek vowels on foll. 4 band 5 a.

layout.p: The number of lines in each page varies from 19 to 21.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of thexiith cent.

decoNote.desc: On fol. 1a there is a coloured figure of the Cross, with the wordsܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

item.p: A very few Greek vowels on foll. 4b and 5a.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Fragments of the Gospel of S. Mark, according to the Peshitta version; Fragments of the Gospel of S. Luke, according to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 2 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Fragments of the Gospel of S. Mark, according to the Peshitta version

note.p: Contains ch. vi. 18—33, fol. 11; ch. ix. 31 —x. 19.
The lessons are rubricated on the margins by the hand of the scribe.

msItem.title: Fragments of the Gospel of S. Luke, according to the Peshitta version

note.p: Contains ch. i. 61—ii. 22, foll. 14, 15; ch. iv. 2—38, foll. 16, 17.
The lessons are rubricated on the margins by the hand of the scribe.

physDesc.p: Seven vellum leaves, about 6 ½ in. by 4 3/4, some of which are slightly stained (Add. 14,466, foll. 11 —17). The signatures of the quires were letters (ܛfol. 11). There are from 21 to 23 lines in each page. The writing is neat and regular, of the xth or xith cent., with occasional Syriac and Greek vowel-points.

collation.p: The signatures of the quires were letters (ܛfol.11).

item.p: Seven leaves, some of which are slightly stained.

layout.p: There are from 21 to 23 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of thexth or xith cent..

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Fragments of the Gospel of S. John, according to the Peshitta version; The Commandments of our Lord, extracted from the four gospels, 99 in number.; Extracts from the Epistles of S. Paul, according to the Peshitta version, ending with 2nd Timothy, ch. iii. 5. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Fragments of the Gospel of S. John, according to the Peshitta version
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܠܡܟ̣ܬܒ ܐܘܢܓܠܝܘܢ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܟܪܘܙܘܬܐ ܕܝܘܚܢܢ ܫܠܝܚܐ: ܕܡܠܠ ܝܘܢܐܝܬ ܒܐܦܣܘܣ
msItem.note: Contains ch. xvii.1—16, xviii. 6—22, xix. 11—24, xix. 38—xx.10, and xx. 25 to the end.

msItem.title: The Commandments of our Lord, extracted from the four gospels, 99 in number.
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܟ̇ܬܒܝܢܢ ܦܘ̈ܩܕܢܐ ܩܕ̈ܝܫܐ: ܕܡܪܢ ܕܒܐ̈ܘܢܓܠܝܐ ܣ̈ܓܝܕܐ ܘܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ:

msItem.title: Extracts from the Epistles of S. Paul, according to the Peshitta version, ending with 2nd Timothy, ch. iii. 5.
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܒܥܘܕܪܢ ܡܪܢ ܟ̇ܬܒܝܢܢ ܡ̈ܠܐ ܡ̈ܓܒܝܬܐ ܡܢ ܦܘܠܘܣ ܩ̇ܪܝܐ ܘܫܠܝܚܐ
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܠܡܟ̣ܬܒ ܟܬܒܘܢܐ ܗܢܐ ܒܥܘܕܪܢ ܡܪܢ

note.p: They are very imperfect, as leaves as wanting after foll.31,35,36, and40.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about. 7 1/8 in. by 5 1/8, consisting of 25 leaves (Add. 14,466, foll. 18—42), several of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 19,22,30,31,33,34,35,37, and 41. The quires are signed with letters (ܝܚand ـܟ). Each page has from 20-25 lines. The writing seems to of the xith or xiith cent., with occasional Syriac vowel-points.

collation.p: The quires are signed with letters (ܝܚandܟـ).

handNote.desc: The writing seems to of thexith or xiith cent..

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The subscription was followed by a note, now erased, the first line of which contained a date, as is clear from the single legible word

head.note: This manuscript contains: Extracts from the Apostolic Epistles; Selections from the writings of several Fathers. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 20 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Selections from the writings of several Fathers
The tract entitled in some manuscriptsof the passions
msItem.incipit: ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܒܕܘ̈ܒܪܐ ܫܦܝܪ̈ܐ ܕܢܐܚܘܢ ܒܥܘܕܪܢܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܨ̇ܒܝ̣ܢ. ܗܠܝܢ ܢܛ̣ܪܘܢ̇ ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: On the eight evil thoughts
msItem.incipit: ܬܡ̈ܢܝܐ ܓܢ̈ܣܐ ܕܚܘ̈ܫܒܐ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ̇. ܕܒܗܘܢ ܡܬܚܫܒ ܟܠ ܚܘܫܒܐ ܕܚ̈ܫܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Other short extracts, including several from the tract commencing:ܐܝܟ ܦܪܚܬܐ ܕܒ̇ܙܥܐ ܐܐܪ
Part of Extracts from Isaiah of Scete
Extracts from the first discourse on the spiritual law

msItem.author: Palladius
msItem.title: Extracts from Palladius' Lives of the Egyptian Fathers

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 7 1/8in. by 5, consisting of 17 leaves (Add. 14,466, foll. 43—59), some of which are much stained and torn. The quires are signed with letters (ܟܒand ܟܓ).Each page has from 19 to 23 lines. This manuscript is written in a tolerably regular handof the xthor xith cent.

collation.p: The quires are signed with letters (ܟܒandܟܓ).

item.p: Some of the leaves are much stained and torn.
Leaves are wanting at thebeginningand after foll.43and44.

layout.p: Each page has from 19 to 23 lines.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a tolerably regular hand of thexth or xith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
ADDED: added missing locus information for msItems
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
Added generic msItem title(s) based on ancestor title
Initial edit: Cleaned up loci and additions in first three msParts.
Deleted mislabeled colophon on the basis that addition1 is too uncertain to be classified.
Edited: filePart 4and incorporated into main file for Box transfer to GitHub
Changed: Files moved to srophe-app-data/data/manuscripts/tei repository.
